attributes.action: address how to improve the demands of almost all Britons want tougher laws governing aggressive and unfair sales practices - reduce rogue traders - pleae advise the public on who to trust (inc bank staff) and how you know their legitimacy
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A survey for the Department for Business, Enterprise and Regulation ahead of new consumer protection regulations to be introduced next month found 96% of people want a crackdown on rogue traders, AOL reports today.

The poll found 90% have had pushy salesmen at the door or on the phone, while 82% had received repeated calls from the same firm despite telling them they were not interested.

Because of the time difference, using overseas telephone centres is wrecking havoc and invading my privacy.

Another 43% of consumers said they had been duped into buying something after receiving misleading information, and 94% had "won" a competition they never entered - including e mail lottery syndictes - the petitioner is calling on the P.M. to address whatever happened to Britsh justice in consumer law.

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
